security: The text is redacted because the public disclosure of the redaction could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and that invasion of privacy would be so substantial that it outweighs the public interest.
summary: This document consists of payroll authorization forms and memoranda related to Elizabeth C. Feeley's employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), specifically within the Martin Luther King Task Force, and includes information regarding her appointment, salary, and confirmation of no familial relationship with any Member of Congress.
summary_one_paragraph: This collection of documents from the HSCA staff payroll records includes an identification form, payroll authorization forms, and internal memoranda concerning the employment of Elizabeth C. Feeley. The forms detail her appointment as a document clerk for the Martin Luther King Task Force effective November 21, 1977, at an annual salary of $12,000, and a subsequent salary adjustment to $14,000 effective March 1, 1978. Additionally, there is a memorandum confirming her role in the Task Force and a form certifying that she is not related to any current Member of Congress, as per House regulations. Social Security numbers have been redacted from the document.
title: Payroll Records of Elizabeth C. Feeley, HSCA Staff
recipient: Tom Howarth, Budget Officer; ALL STAFF
